text: Seventy-ninth session
Agenda item 21 (b)
Groups of countries in special situations: follow-up to the third United Nations Conference on Landlocked Developing Countries
Resolution adopted by the General Assembly on 19 December 2024
[on the report of the Second Committee (A/79/440/Add.2, para. 8)]
79/219.	Follow-up to the Third United Nations Conference on Landlocked Developing Countries
The General Assembly,

Recalling the Vienna Declaration, the Vienna Programme of Action for Landlocked Developing Countries for the Decade 2014–2024 and the Political Declaration of the High-level Midterm Review on the Implementation of the Vienna Programme of Action for Landlocked Developing Countries for the Decade 2014–2024,
textWithHighlights: *Recalling* the Vienna Declaration, the Vienna Programme of Action for Landlocked Developing Countries for the Decade 2014–2024 and the Political Declaration of the High-level Midterm Review on the Implementation of the Vienna Programme of Action for Landlocked Developing Countries for the Decade 2014–2024,

text: Reaffirming the overarching goal of the Vienna Programme of Action of addressing the special development needs and challenges of landlocked developing countries arising from their landlockedness, remoteness and geographical constraints in a more coherent manner and thus contributing to an enhanced rate of sustainable and inclusive growth, which can contribute to the eradication of poverty in all its forms and dimensions, including extreme poverty,
textWithHighlights: *Reaffirming* the overarching goal of the Vienna Programme of Action of addressing the special development needs and challenges of {{landlocked developing countries}} arising from their landlockedness, remoteness and geographical constraints in a more coherent manner and thus contributing to an enhanced rate of sustainable and inclusive growth, which can contribute to the eradication of poverty in all its forms and dimensions, including extreme poverty,
uncertainties: Vienna Programme of Action is treated as a document, not an entity, so it is not annotated as a mentioned entity.

text: Recalling its resolutions 71/239 of 21 December 2016, 72/232 of 20 December 2017, 73/243 of 20 December 2018, 74/233 of 19 December 2019 and 75/228 of 21 December 2020,
textWithHighlights: *Recalling* its resolutions 71/239 of 21 December 2016, 72/232 of 20 December 2017, 73/243 of 20 December 2018, 74/233 of 19 December 2019 and 75/228 of 21 December 2020,

text: Recalling also its resolution 76/217 of 17 December 2021, in which the General Assembly decided to convene the third United Nations Conference on Landlocked Developing Countries in 2024, its resolutions 77/246 of 30 December 2022 and 78/163 of 19 December 2023, which outlined modalities for the third United Nations Conference on Landlocked Developing Countries, and its resolutions 77/329 of 25 August 2023 and 78/315 of 10 July 2024 on further modalities of the third United Nations Conference on Landlocked Developing Countries,
textWithHighlights: *Recalling also* its resolution 76/217 of 17 December 2021, in which the {{General Assembly}} decided to convene the third United Nations Conference on Landlocked Developing Countries in 2024, its resolutions 77/246 of 30 December 2022 and 78/163 of 19 December 2023, which outlined modalities for the third United Nations Conference on Landlocked Developing Countries, and its resolutions 77/329 of 25 August 2023 and 78/315 of 10 July 2024 on further modalities of the third United Nations Conference on Landlocked Developing Countries,

text: Recalling further the meetings of the Preparatory Committee for the third United Nations Conference on Landlocked Developing Countries held from 5 to 8 February 2024 and on 3 June 2024 and taking note with appreciation of its outcomes, and taking note of the outcomes of the three regional review meetings of the landlocked developing countries, with one meeting in Africa, held in Gaborone on 29 and 30 May 2023, one meeting in Latin America, held in Asunción on 27 and 28 July 2023, and one meeting in Europe and Asia, held in Bangkok on 22 and 23 August 2023,

mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity_normalized: Preparatory Committee for the third United Nations Conference on Landlocked Developing Countries
mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity: Preparatory Committee for the third United Nations Conference on Landlocked Developing Countries

mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity_normalized: Preparatory Committee for the third United Nations Conference on Landlocked Developing Countries
mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity: Preparatory Committee for the third United Nations Conference on Landlocked Developing Countries

textWithHighlights: *Recalling further* the meetings of the {{Preparatory Committee for the third United Nations Conference on Landlocked Developing Countries}} held from 5 to 8 February 2024 and on 3 June 2024 and *taking note with appreciation* of its outcomes, and *taking note* of the outcomes of the three regional review meetings of the {{landlocked developing countries}}, with one meeting in Africa, held in Gaborone on 29 and 30 May 2023, one meeting in Latin America, held in Asunción on 27 and 28 July 2023, and one meeting in Europe and Asia, held in Bangkok on 22 and 23 August 2023,
uncertainties: Classification of 'taking note with appreciation' as observing (rather than evaluative) and categorization of the Preparatory Committee as 'other' since it is not explicitly listed among entities.

text: Noting with great concern the severe negative impact on human health, safety and well-being caused by the coronavirus disease (COVID-19) pandemic, as well as the severe disruption to societies and economies and the devastating impact on lives and livelihoods, and that the poorest and most vulnerable are the hardest hit by the pandemic, reaffirming the ambition to get back on track to achieve the Sustainable Development Goals by designing and implementing sustainable and inclusive recovery strategies to accelerate progress towards the full implementation of the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development and to help to reduce the risk of and build resilience to future shocks, crises and pandemics, including by strengthening health systems and achieving universal health coverage, and recognizing that equitable and timely access for all to safe, quality, effective and affordable COVID-19 vaccines, therapeutics and diagnostics are an essential part of a global response based on unity, solidarity, renewed multilateral cooperation and the principle of leaving no one behind,
textWithHighlights: *Noting with great concern* the severe negative impact on human health, safety and well-being caused by the coronavirus disease (COVID-19) pandemic, as well as the severe disruption to societies and economies and the devastating impact on lives and livelihoods, and that the poorest and most vulnerable are the hardest hit by the pandemic, *reaffirming* the ambition to get back on track to achieve the Sustainable Development Goals by designing and implementing sustainable and inclusive recovery strategies to accelerate progress towards the full implementation of the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development and to help to reduce the risk of and build resilience to future shocks, crises and pandemics, including by strengthening health systems and achieving universal health coverage, and *recognizing* that equitable and timely access for all to safe, quality, effective and affordable COVID-19 vaccines, therapeutics and diagnostics are an essential part of a global response based on unity, solidarity, renewed multilateral cooperation and the principle of leaving no one behind,

text: Looking forward to the convening of the Third United Nations Conference on Landlocked Developing Countries and the adoption of the new Programme of Action for Landlocked Developing Countries for the Decade 2024–2034,
textWithHighlights: *Looking forward* to the convening of the Third United Nations Conference on Landlocked Developing Countries and the adoption of the new Programme of Action for Landlocked Developing Countries for the Decade 2024–2034,

text: Recognizing the importance of national-level implementation of the new Programme of Action and its mainstreaming into national development plans and strategies,
textWithHighlights: *Recognizing* the importance of national-level implementation of the new Programme of Action and its mainstreaming into national development plans and strategies,

text: Reaffirming its resolution 70/1 of 25 September 2015, entitled “Transforming our world: the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development”, in which it adopted a comprehensive, far-reaching and people-centred set of universal and transformative Sustainable Development Goals and targets, its commitment to working tirelessly for the full implementation of the Agenda by 2030, its recognition that eradicating poverty in all its forms and dimensions, including extreme poverty, is the greatest global challenge and an indispensable requirement for sustainable development, its commitment to achieving sustainable development in its three dimensions – economic, social and environmental – in a balanced and integrated manner, and to building upon the achievements of the Millennium Development Goals and seeking to address their unfinished business,
textWithHighlights: *Reaffirming* its resolution 70/1 of 25 September 2015, entitled “Transforming our world: the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development”, in which it adopted a comprehensive, far-reaching and people-centred set of universal and transformative Sustainable Development Goals and targets, its commitment to working tirelessly for the full implementation of the Agenda by 2030, its recognition that eradicating poverty in all its forms and dimensions, including extreme poverty, is the greatest global challenge and an indispensable requirement for sustainable development, its commitment to achieving sustainable development in its three dimensions – economic, social and environmental – in a balanced and integrated manner, and to building upon the achievements of the Millennium Development Goals and seeking to address their unfinished business,

text: Reiterating the pledge that no one will be left behind, reaffirming the recognition that the dignity of the human person is fundamental, and the wish to see the Goals and targets met for all nations and peoples and for all segments of society, and recommitting to endeavour to reach the furthest behind first,
textWithHighlights: *Reiterating* the pledge that no one will be left behind, *reaffirming* the recognition that the dignity of the human person is fundamental, and the wish to see the Goals and targets met for all nations and peoples and for all segments of society, and *recommitting* to endeavour to reach the furthest behind first,

text: Reaffirming its resolution 69/313 of 27 July 2015 on the Addis Ababa Action Agenda of the Third International Conference on Financing for Development, which is an integral part of the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development, supports and complements it, helps to contextualize its means of implementation targets with concrete policies and actions, and reaffirms the strong political commitment to address the challenge of financing and creating an enabling environment at all levels for sustainable development in the spirit of global partnership and solidarity,
textWithHighlights: *Reaffirming* its resolution 69/313 of 27 July 2015 on the Addis Ababa Action Agenda of the Third International Conference on Financing for Development, which is an integral part of the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development, supports and complements it, helps to contextualize its means of implementation targets with concrete policies and actions, and reaffirms the strong political commitment to address the challenge of financing and creating an enabling environment at all levels for sustainable development in the spirit of global partnership and solidarity,

text: Looking forward to the convening of the Fourth International Conference for Financing for Development, to be held in Seville, Spain, from 30 June to 3 July 2025,
textWithHighlights: *Looking forward to* the convening of the Fourth International Conference for Financing for Development, to be held in Seville, {{Spain}}, from 30 June to 3 July 2025,

text: Reaffirming the Paris Agreement and its early entry into force, encouraging all its parties to fully implement the Agreement, and parties to the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change that have not yet done so to deposit their instruments of ratification, acceptance, approval or accession, where appropriate, as soon as possible,
textWithHighlights: *Reaffirming* the Paris Agreement and its early entry into force, *encouraging* all its parties to fully implement the Agreement, and parties to the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change that have not yet done so to deposit their instruments of ratification, acceptance, approval or accession, where appropriate, as soon as possible,
uncertainties: This is a preambular paragraph using -ing forms. Although it contains a directive verb ('encouraging') and concrete actions (depositing instruments), per instructions assignees and deliverables are not extracted for preambular text. If treated as operative, assignees could be 'Paris Agreement parties' / 'UNFCCC parties' and a deliverable could be 'deposit instruments of ratification/acceptance/approval/accession' (legislation).

text: Welcoming the convening of the Summit of the Future on 22-23 September 2024 at the United Nations Headquarters in New York, at which resolution 79/1 entitled “The Pact for the Future” and its annexes were adopted,
textWithHighlights: *Welcoming* the convening of the Summit of the Future on 22-23 September 2024 at the United Nations Headquarters in New York, at which resolution 79/1 entitled “The Pact for the Future” and its annexes were adopted,

text: Reaffirming the Doha Programme of Action for the Least Developed Countries, which represents a new generation of renewed and strengthened commitments between the least developed countries and their development partners, including the private sector, civil society and governments at all levels, cognizant that many landlocked developing countries belong to the least developed country category,
textWithHighlights: *Reaffirming* the Doha Programme of Action for the {{Least Developed Countries}}, which represents a new generation of renewed and strengthened commitments between the {{least developed countries}} and their development partners, including the {{private sector}}, {{civil society}} and governments at all levels, cognizant that many {{landlocked developing countries}} belong to the least developed country category,

text: Reaffirming also the recognition of the special needs and challenges of landlocked developing countries in the 2030 Agenda and in the Addis Ababa Action Agenda,
textWithHighlights: *Reaffirming also* the recognition of the special needs and challenges of {{landlocked developing countries}} in the 2030 Agenda and in the Addis Ababa Action Agenda,
uncertainties: Documents such as the 2030 Agenda and the Addis Ababa Action Agenda are referenced but not included as entities per the provided list. Included 'also' in the verb highlight as a specifier.

text: Takes note of the report of the Secretary-General on the Third United Nations Conference on Landlocked Developing Countries;
textWithHighlights: *Takes note* of the report of the {{Secretary-General}} on the Third United Nations Conference on Landlocked Developing Countries;

text: Reaffirms the commitment at the very heart of the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development to leave no one behind and commit to taking more tangible steps to support people in vulnerable situations and the most vulnerable countries and to reach the furthest behind first;
textWithHighlights: *Reaffirms* the commitment at the very heart of the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development to leave no one behind and *commit* to taking more tangible steps to support people in vulnerable situations and the most vulnerable countries and to reach the furthest behind first;
uncertainties: The text uses both 'Reaffirms' and 'commit' in one sentence; treated as two operative verbs. The assignee for 'commit' is implicitly the General Assembly. No concrete deliverables identified, as 'taking more tangible steps' is vague.

text: Welcomes the political declaration adopted by the high-level political forum on sustainable development convened under the auspices of the General Assembly, held in New York on 18 and 19 September 2023, and urges timely action to ensure its full implementation;

mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity: high-level political forum on sustainable development

textWithHighlights: *Welcomes* the political declaration adopted by the {{high-level political forum on sustainable development}} convened under the auspices of the {{General Assembly}}, held in New York on 18 and 19 September 2023, and *urges* timely action to ensure its full implementation;
uncertainties: No explicit assignee is provided for 'urges'; no concrete deliverable identified beyond a general call for timely action/implementation, so none was extracted.

text: relevant organizations and bodies of the United Nations system, and invites international organizations and relevant regional and subregional organizations, to integrate the new  for Landlocked Developing Countries for the Decade 2024–2034 into their programmes of work, as appropriate, within their respective mandates, and to support landlocked and transit developing countries in their implementation of the Programme of Action in a well-‍coordinated and coherent manner;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Integrate the new Programme of Action for landlocked developing countries (2024–2034) into programmes of work
Support landlocked and transit developing countries in implementing the Programme of Action

textWithHighlights: relevant organizations and bodies of the {{United Nations system}}, and *invites* <<international organizations>> and relevant <<regional and subregional organizations>>, to [[integrate]] the new  for {{Landlocked Developing Countries}} for the Decade 2024–2034 into their programmes of work, as appropriate, within their respective mandates, and to [[support]] landlocked and {{transit developing countries}} in their implementation of the Programme of Action in a well-‍coordinated and coherent manner;
uncertainties: The paragraph appears truncated at the start (likely missing a verb before 'relevant organizations and bodies of the United Nations system') and the phrase 'the new  for Landlocked Developing Countries' seems to be missing a term (likely 'Programme of Action'). Due to the missing initial verb, 'relevant organizations and bodies of the United Nations system' was treated as a mentioned entity rather than an assignee.

text: Underlines that the Office of the High Representative for the Least Developed Countries, Landlocked Developing Countries and Small Island Developing States should be provided with adequate resources to fulfil its mandate for the timely and effective follow-up, monitoring and implementation of the new Programme of Action and to extend effective support to the landlocked developing countries, and requests the Secretary-General to address the allocation of adequate resources for the Office in the context of the proposed programme budget for 2026;

mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity: Office of the High Representative for the Least Developed Countries, Landlocked Developing Countries and Small Island Developing States

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Allocation of adequate resources for UN-OHRLLS in 2026 programme budget

textWithHighlights: *Underlines* that the {{Office of the High Representative for the Least Developed Countries, Landlocked Developing Countries and Small Island Developing States}} should be provided with adequate resources to fulfil its mandate for the timely and effective follow-up, monitoring and implementation of the new Programme of Action and to extend effective support to the {{landlocked developing countries}}, and *requests* the <<Secretary-General>> to address the [[allocation of adequate resources]] for the Office in the context of the proposed programme budget for 2026;

text: Requests Governments, intergovernmental and non-governmental organizations, major groups and other donors to contribute in a timely manner to the trust fund in support of activities undertaken by the Office of the High Representative to support the implementation of, follow-up to and monitoring of the new Programme of Action;
textWithHighlights: *Requests* <<Governments>>, <<intergovernmental and non-governmental organizations>>, <<major groups>> and other donors to [[contribute]] in a timely manner to the trust fund in support of activities undertaken by the {{Office of the High Representative}} to support the implementation of, follow-up to and monitoring of the new Programme of Action;

text: Requests the Secretary-General to submit to the General Assembly at its eightieth session a report on the Third United Nations Conference on Landlocked Developing Countries, and decides to include in the provisional agenda of its eightieth session, under the item entitled “Groups of countries in special situations”, the sub-item entitled “Follow-up to the Third United Nations Conference on Landlocked Developing Countries”.

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Report on the Third UN Conference on Landlocked Developing Countries
Sub-item on follow-up to the Third UN Conference on Landlocked Developing Countries included in GA eightieth session agenda

textWithHighlights: *Requests* the <<Secretary-General>> to submit to the {{General Assembly}} at its eightieth session a [[report]] on the Third United Nations Conference on {{Landlocked Developing Countries}}, and *decides* to include in the provisional agenda of its eightieth session, under the item entitled “Groups of countries in special situations”, the [[sub-item]] entitled “Follow-up to the Third United Nations Conference on Landlocked Developing Countries”.
uncertainties: Classified inclusion of a sub-item in the GA agenda under deliverable type 'meeting'; alternative classifications (e.g., policy/administrative) could be argued.

text: 54th plenary meeting
19 December 2024
